analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na rgyal po lha'i zla ba zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig kho nas dzambu'i gling gi dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na rgyal po lha'i zla ba zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig kho nas dzambu'i gling gi dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa /
translated: in the past, earlier than the beginningless past, beyond a very long time ago, there was a king named Divākara, who alone ruled over the lord of Jambudvīpa.

original: chos kyi bdag @383a *//
analyzed: chos kyi bdag @383a *//
translated: He was a righteous king,

original: po chos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: po chos dang ldan pa /
translated: a righteous lord,

original: chos kyis mi mthun pa med par rgyal srid byed pa zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyis mi mthun pa med par rgyal srid byed pa zhig byung ngo //
translated: who ruled the kingdom without conflict through the Dharma.

original: bu'ang stong tham pa yod de /
analyzed: bu'ang stong tham pa yod de /
translated: He had a thousand sons,

original: dpa' zhing rtul phod pa yan lag mchog gi gzugs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dpa' zhing rtul phod pa yan lag mchog gi gzugs dang ldan pa /
translated: all of whom were brave and heroic, with the bodies of great strength.

original: pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa dag byung ngo //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa dag byung ngo //
translated: They were able to destroy the armies of all enemies.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten sgron ma zhes bya ba zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten sgron ma zhes bya ba zhig byung ngo //
translated: At that time there appeared a buddha named Lokapradīpa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten sgron ma zhes bya ba de byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa yang dag par rab tu ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten sgron ma zhes bya ba de byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa yang dag par rab tu ston te /
translated: This buddha taught only the bodhisattva canon,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las brtsams te mi ston to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las brtsams te mi ston to //
translated: not the śrāvaka canon or the pratyekabuddha canon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why was this?

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa des sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa yang dag par 'dzin du btsud de /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa des sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sems can thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa yang dag par 'dzin du btsud de /
translated: Because in the past, when this buddha was a bodhisattva, he had caused all sentient beings to accept the bodhisattva canon.

original: sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la yang dag par rab tu gnas so //
translated: All those sentient beings were established in the bodhisattva canon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa des de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa des de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa nyid bstan te /
translated: That Tathagata taught them the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la nges par byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la nges par byung ngo //
translated: All those beings were established in the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stongs zhes bya ba tshogs @383b de thams cad kyi gtso bo byed pa zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stongs zhes bya ba tshogs @383b de thams cad kyi gtso bo byed pa zhig byung ngo //
translated: At that time, in that Buddha-field of that Tathagata, there was a Bodhisattva called Sarthavaha, who was the leader of that assembly.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i bdud shugs 'chang zhes bya ba gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag gi bar chad byed par nye bar gnas pa zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de'i bdud shugs 'chang zhes bya ba gang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag gi bar chad byed par nye bar gnas pa zhig byung ngo //
translated: At that time, there was a Mara called Balamitra who was a hindrance to that assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: de byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam zer ro //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam zer ro //
translated: He spoke to those Bodhisattvas about omniscience.

original: de nas bdud shugs 'chang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas bdud shugs 'chang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Mara Balamitra thought this:

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten sgron ma 'dis yun mi ring bar bdag gi yul stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten sgron ma 'dis yun mi ring bar bdag gi yul stong par 'gyur te /
translated: ‘This Tathāgata, this lamp of the world, will not remain for long, and my realm will be emptied.

original: gang bdag gis de'i bar chad bya'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gis de'i bar chad bya'o //
translated: I will create obstacles for him.’

original: snyam nas de sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mngon par sprul nas 'khor gyi nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: snyam nas de sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su mngon par sprul nas 'khor gyi nang du zhugs te /
translated: He then manifested himself in the form of a buddha and entered the assembly.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag gi nang du 'dug nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam ngan pa bsngags la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag gi nang du 'dug nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam ngan pa bsngags la /
translated: He sat in the midst of that assembly of bodhisattvas and spoke unwholesome words about omniscience.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam zer ro; ;byang chub sems dpa' de dag la'ang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag nye bar 'bul te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam zer ro; ;byang chub sems dpa' de dag la'ang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag nye bar 'bul te /
translated: He spoke words that were in accord with the objects of desire and offered the five objects of desire to those bodhisattvas.

original: mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba gzugs mang po dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i yo byad dang / me tog gi yo byad dang / bldag pa'i yo byad dang / rol mo'i yo byad dang / glu dbyangs kyi yo byad dang /
analyzed: mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba gzugs mang po dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i yo byad dang / me tog gi yo byad dang / bldag pa'i yo byad dang / rol mo'i yo byad dang / glu dbyangs kyi yo byad dang /
translated: He offered them many forms that are objects of visual consciousness, and he offered them food and drink, flowers, betel, music, and song.

original: gar gyi yo byad rnams 'bul bar byed @384a *//
analyzed: gar gyi yo byad rnams 'bul bar byed @384a *//
translated: and the requisites for dancing.

original: do; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stobs de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: do; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stobs de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Śūrasena thought,

original: gang bdag gis bdud shugs 'chang 'di bdag gi shugs kyis gdul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gis bdud shugs 'chang 'di bdag gi shugs kyis gdul bar bya'o //
translated: “I will tame this Māra Balāka with my own strength.”

original: snyam nas ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed ba mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: snyam nas ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed ba mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: He performed a miracle such that

original: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'dus byas pas bdud shugs 'chang gi mgul du khyi ro zhig btags so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'dus byas pas bdud shugs 'chang gi mgul du khyi ro zhig btags so //
translated: he tied a dead dog around the neck of Māra Balāka.

original: shugs 'tshang gi gzugs kyis bdud kyi gnas der song ngo //
analyzed: shugs 'tshang gi gzugs kyis bdud kyi gnas der song ngo //
translated: He went to the abode of Māra in the form of Balāka.

original: song nas bdud kyi gnas der zhugs te lha'i bu mo khri phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dag byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du bcug go /
analyzed: song nas bdud kyi gnas der zhugs te lha'i bu mo khri phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dag byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du bcug go /
translated: Having gone there, he entered the abode of Māra and caused ninety-nine thousand celestial maidens to take up enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam de lta bu dag byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par ldan pa'i gtam de lta bu dag byas te /
translated: The bodhisattva Śūrasena spoke such words of truth,

original: 'di ltar lha'i bu mo khri phrag de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to; ;lha'i bu mo khri phrag de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog pa nyid la btsud nas bdud kyi gnas de nyid du 'dod
analyzed: 'di ltar lha'i bu mo khri phrag de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to; ;lha'i bu mo khri phrag de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog pa nyid la btsud nas bdud kyi gnas de nyid du 'dod
translated: In this way, those hundreds of thousands of divine sons became irreversible from unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: pa'i yon tan lnga dag gis bdag nyid rtse ba mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: pa'i yon tan lnga dag gis bdag nyid rtse ba mngon par sprul to //
translated: Having established all those hundreds of thousands of divine sons in irreversibility, he manifested himself in the realm of Mara, enjoying the five sensory pleasures.

original: de nas bdud shugs 'chang khyi ro btags pa de rang gi gnas gal ba der song ba dang / gnas de na lha'i bu dang / lha'i bu mo de dag dang lhan cig @384b tu rtse zhing yongs su spyod ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas bdud shugs 'chang khyi ro btags pa de rang gi gnas gal ba der song ba dang / gnas de na lha'i bu dang / lha'i bu mo de dag dang lhan cig @384b tu rtse zhing yongs su spyod ba mthong ngo //
translated: Then Mara, the evil one, went to his own abode, where he saw the divine sons and daughters playing and enjoying themselves together.

original: mthong nas kyang sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la /
translated: Having seen this, he became miserable, unhappy,

original: blong blong por gyur cing der mi dga'o //
analyzed: blong blong por gyur cing der mi dga'o //
translated: and disgusted, and he did not enjoy being there.

original: de nas lha'i bu mo khri phrag dgu bcu po de dag bdud shugs 'chang blong blong bor gyur par rig nas snying rje chen po skyes te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu mo khri phrag dgu bcu po de dag bdud shugs 'chang blong blong bor gyur par rig nas snying rje chen po skyes te /
translated: Then those nine hundred thousand divine daughters, seeing that Mara, the evil one, was miserable, gave rise to great compassion.

original: bdud shugs 'chang 'di srog chags rnams kyi phyir sdig pa'i ros blong blong por gyur cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pa la ltos /
analyzed: bdud shugs 'chang 'di srog chags rnams kyi phyir sdig pa'i ros blong blong por gyur cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pa la ltos /
translated: Look at this Māra Vemacitrin, who is filled with the taste of evil for the sake of living beings and does not know the truth as it is.

original: kye ae ma slob dpon dpa' ba'i stobs bdud shugs 'chang 'di bdag cag gi bdud kyi gnas la dbang phyug gi dbang gis bgegs bgyid par 'gyur na /
analyzed: kye ae ma slob dpon dpa' ba'i stobs bdud shugs 'chang 'di bdag cag gi bdud kyi gnas la dbang phyug gi dbang gis bgegs bgyid par 'gyur na /
translated: “Alas, Master Śūrabala, Māra Vemacitrin is obstructing our dominion over the abode of Māra.

original: bdag cag la 'tshe bar mi 'gyur bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag la 'tshe bar mi 'gyur bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: Please do not harm us.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stobs kyis ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stobs kyis ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Śūrabala performed a miraculous feat.

original: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'dus byas pas bdud shugs 'chang gi gnas kyi gong du bdud kyi gnas gzhan ches rdzu 'phrul che ba /🔽ches gzi brjid che ba /🔽ches mthu che ba /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'dus byas pas bdud shugs 'chang gi gnas kyi gong du bdud kyi gnas gzhan ches rdzu 'phrul che ba / ches gzi brjid che ba / ches mthu che ba /
translated: Through that miraculous feat, he emanated another abode of Māra above the abode of Māra Vemacitrin,🔽which was even more miraculous,🔽more majestic,

original: ches gzi che ba zhig mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: ches gzi che ba zhig mngon par sprul to //
translated: and more powerful.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan zhig kyang mngon par sprul te der bdud de dbang phyug la dbang byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan zhig kyang mngon par sprul te der bdud de dbang phyug la dbang byed de /
translated: He also manifested another world system, where that Māra was the lord.

original: des gnas de dang bdud de'ang thal bar brlags so //
analyzed: des gnas de dang bdud de'ang thal bar brlags so //
translated: He reduced that place and that Māra to dust.

original: de nas @385a *//
analyzed: de nas @385a *//
translated: Then

original: bdud shugs 'chang gis bdud de dang bdud kyi gnas de mthong nas yid gnyis su gyur te /
analyzed: bdud shugs 'chang gis bdud de dang bdud kyi gnas de mthong nas yid gnyis su gyur te /
translated: the Māra Vegadhārin saw that Māra and that Māra’s place and became doubtful.

original: bdag kyang yun mi ring bar 'chi ba'i chos su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang yun mi ring bar 'chi ba'i chos su 'gyur ro //
translated: “I too will soon become subject to death.

original: bdud kyi gnas 'dis bdag gi ngo bo dang / yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad dang tha dad pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi gnas 'dis bdag gi ngo bo dang / yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad dang tha dad pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: This Māra’s place will become different from my own essence and all my possessions.”

original: snyam mo // de nas de dag gis de kun tu skyo bar gyur cing yid mi dga' bar gyur nas 'jigs skrag blong blong por gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stobs de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: snyam mo // de nas de dag gis de kun tu skyo bar gyur cing yid mi dga' bar gyur nas 'jigs skrag blong blong por gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' dpa' ba'i stobs de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, all of them, feeling completely sad and unhappy, frightened, terrified, and anxious, said this to the bodhisattva Śūradhvaja:

original: mkhas pa mgon med mgon mdzod rnam par ltung las dgrol bar mdzod //
analyzed: mkhas pa mgon med mgon mdzod rnam par ltung las dgrol bar mdzod //
translated: “Wise one, protector of the unprotected, please liberate us from this downfall!”

original: byis pa'i ngo bo bdag gis mi dge gang bgyis mi rtag pas //
analyzed: byis pa'i ngo bo bdag gis mi dge gang bgyis mi rtag pas //
translated: I have done many nonvirtuous things in my childishness.

original: srid par 'gro ba kun gnod rtag pa ma lus mthol zhing mchis //
analyzed: srid par 'gro ba kun gnod rtag pa ma lus mthol zhing mchis //
translated: I confess all the harm I have done in all my existences in cyclic existence.

original: rnam 'jig chos kyi dngos po cung zad mgon skyabs bgyis ma mchis //
analyzed: rnam 'jig chos kyi dngos po cung zad mgon skyabs bgyis ma mchis //
translated: I have not protected even a little of the things that are to be destroyed.

original: rnam 'jig chos kun bdag gis rnam spangs bdag kyang ma grol ba //
analyzed: rnam 'jig chos kun bdag gis rnam spangs bdag kyang ma grol ba //
translated: I have abandoned all things that are to be destroyed, but I am not liberated.

original: 'di ltar bzod par mdzod cig dpa' stobs bde bar gshegs pa'i sras //
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod par mdzod cig dpa' stobs bde bar gshegs pa'i sras //
translated: Therefore, O sons of the Sugata, who are heroic and powerful,🔽be patient with me, who is frightened, terrified, and weak.

original: rtabs la skrag cing nyams pas de yi yid kyi skyo ba chad; ;nga rgyal rnam spangs rgyal ba'i sras la thams cad skyabs su zhugs //
analyzed: rtabs la skrag cing nyams pas de yi yid kyi skyo ba chad; ;nga rgyal rnam spangs rgyal ba'i sras la thams cad skyabs su zhugs //
translated: I go for refuge to all of you, O sons of the Jina, who have abandoned pride.

original: gang gis rgung 'jigs yongs mthong 'di ltar khyod la skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: gang gis rgung 'jigs yongs mthong 'di ltar khyod la skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to you, O you who see the terrors of old age.

original: rgyal @385b sras mkhas pa sdug bsngal nyams pa dag las bdag la skyobs //
analyzed: rgyal @385b sras mkhas pa sdug bsngal nyams pa dag las bdag la skyobs //
translated: O wise sons of the Jina, protect me from the terrors of suffering.

original: shugs 'chang skyo ba rgyal ba'i sras kyis gzigs nas des smras pa //
analyzed: shugs 'chang skyo ba rgyal ba'i sras kyis gzigs nas des smras pa //
translated: The bodhisattva Dṛḍhabala, seeing that he was frightened, said to him:🔽“Do not be afraid, O king!

original: grogs po rgyal ba'i sras la bgegs mi byed cing nga rgyal spongs //
analyzed: grogs po rgyal ba'i sras la bgegs mi byed cing nga rgyal spongs //
translated: Do not create obstacles for the friends, the Bodhisattvas, and abandon pride.

original: srid kun mi rtag yongs su 'dzin la mngon par zhen pa thong //
analyzed: srid kun mi rtag yongs su 'dzin la mngon par zhen pa thong //
translated: All existence is impermanent; abandon attachment to what is grasped.

original: sems ni mngon par dad pas nges par 'byung ba rab tu shes //
analyzed: sems ni mngon par dad pas nges par 'byung ba rab tu shes //
translated: The mind is known to be definitely liberated by clear faith.

original: sems can gang yang 'khrugs pa'i yid kyi chos zhes nam yang med //
analyzed: sems can gang yang 'khrugs pa'i yid kyi chos zhes nam yang med //
translated: There is never any Dharma of a disturbed mind for any sentient being.

original: yid kyi rnyog pa bsal btang rgyal ba mchog gi bstan pa mthong //
analyzed: yid kyi rnyog pa bsal btang rgyal ba mchog gi bstan pa mthong //
translated: Having removed the turbidity of the mind, see the teaching of the supreme Victor.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said:

original: rgyal sras bdag sems rnyog pa bral zhing yid kyis rnam par 'bad //
analyzed: rgyal sras bdag sems rnyog pa bral zhing yid kyis rnam par 'bad //
translated: “Son of the Victor, my mind is free from turbidity and I exert myself mentally.

original: rgyal ba'i rim gro bgyid kyi rgyal ba'i gsung dag gsungs shig gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i rim gro bgyid kyi rgyal ba'i gsung dag gsungs shig gsungs //
translated: I will serve the Victor; please speak the words of the Victor.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan byang chub sems la bdud nyon cig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan byang chub sems la bdud nyon cig /
translated: “Listen, Mara, the qualities of the Tathagata are in the mind of the Bodhisattva.

original: bde gshegs sras las gang dag thos pa bdud kyi zhags pa gcod //
analyzed: bde gshegs sras las gang dag thos pa bdud kyi zhags pa gcod //
translated: Those who hear from the sons of the Sugata cut the noose of Mara.

original: rgyal bas rab gsungs chos nyid mi g-yo 'gyur med chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: rgyal bas rab gsungs chos nyid mi g-yo 'gyur med chos kyi dbyings //
translated: The Dharma nature well taught by the Victor is the immovable, unchanging dharmadhatu.

original: rgyal ba'i sras 'di shes na rgyal bas mchod pa byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras 'di shes na rgyal bas mchod pa byas par 'gyur //
translated: If one knows this son of the Victor, one will have made offerings to the Victor.

original: bdag dang blo nges med pa so so'i skye bo byis pa zhes //
analyzed: bdag dang blo nges med pa so so'i skye bo byis pa zhes //
translated: “I” and “mind” are uncertain, and the individual is called “childish.”

original: bya ste de ltar sems nges med pa kun rtog rlung dang 'dra //
analyzed: bya ste de ltar sems nges med pa kun rtog rlung dang 'dra //
translated: Thus, the uncertain mind is like the wind of imagination.

original: gang dag rgyal ba'i gsung ni rnam shes de dag bdud kyi zhags //
analyzed: gang dag rgyal ba'i gsung ni rnam shes de dag bdud kyi zhags //
translated: Those who are the speech of the Victor are the consciousnesses, and they are the fetters of Māra.

original: rlung gi stobs kyis phub ma 'phyar ltar ma lus shin tu @386a *//
analyzed: rlung gi stobs kyis phub ma 'phyar ltar ma lus shin tu @386a *//
translated: Like chaff blown by the wind, they are completely destroyed.

original: bcom; ;'gyur med chos dbyings stong pa mi g-yo gnyis med smras pa ni //
analyzed: bcom; ;'gyur med chos dbyings stong pa mi g-yo gnyis med smras pa ni //
translated: The unchanging, immovable, nondual, empty realm of phenomena is said to be

original: bdud stobs 'joms par byed cing bdud dbang song bas shes par dka'//
analyzed: bdud stobs 'joms par byed cing bdud dbang song bas shes par dka'//
translated: the destroyer of the power of Māra, and it is difficult to know because it is under the power of Māra.

original: sems can gang dag skyes dang 'chi dang 'byung ba gang yang med //
analyzed: sems can gang dag skyes dang 'chi dang 'byung ba gang yang med //

translated: and should give away worldly goods.

analyzed: moonggal gyi bu / ngas brtson 'grus shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag sems can thams cad kyi don du brtson 'grus shes pa ji ltar rtogs par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba sna @400b tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: par 'dus byas so //
analyzed: par 'dus byas so //
translated: in the past, when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct in order to understand the knowledge of diligence, I thought, “How can I, for the sake of all beings, understand the knowledge of diligence?” And I accumulated immeasurable various roots of virtue.🔽Mañjuśrī,

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na ded dpon slong ldan zhes bya ba phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na ded dpon slong ldan zhes bya ba phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba /

original: sngon nas rab tu nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: sngon nas rab tu nyon mongs pa med pa /

analyzed: ded dpon gyi bu ded dpon gyi bza'i rigs khong du chud par ldan pa zhig byung ngo //

original: de'i pha'i bsam pa /
analyzed: de'i pha'i bsam pa /
translated: His father thought,

analyzed: bdag ji ltar 'di dang mi 'bral bar bya /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bdag la bdun brgyud tshun chad kyi nor rdzas mang po ma nyams par yod de //
translated: Because I have many possessions and wealth that have been passed down to me for seven generations,

original: des na gzhon nu 'di 'tsho ba bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhon nu 'di 'tsho ba bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: so this young man will have an easy life.”

original: snyam mo // de skyes ma thag tu tshong pa gang dag gi khye'u shed mnyam du skyes pa de dag pha mas de'i sten grogs su byin te /
analyzed: snyam mo // de skyes ma thag tu tshong pa gang dag gi khye'u shed mnyam du skyes pa de dag pha mas de'i sten grogs su byin te /
translated: As soon as he was born, the parents of the merchants’ sons who were born at the same time as him gave them to him as playmates.

original: bu / sten grogs 'di dag dang de ltar lhan cig tu dga' bar rtses shig /
analyzed: bu / sten grogs 'di dag dang de ltar lhan cig tu dga' bar rtses shig /
translated: “Son, play and enjoy yourself with these playmates.”

original: yongs su spyod cig /
analyzed: yongs su spyod cig /

analyzed: de khyim bdag de nyid kyi nang na bzo thams cad slob tu bcug ste /
translated: He was then made to study all the arts in the house of that householder.

analyzed: der yi ge dang / der bgrang ba dang / der grangs dang / der tshong pa'i tha snyad dang / der zhing rmed pa'i tha snyad dang / der bzo'i tha snyad dang / der bzo thams cad dang / tha na las byed pa'i bzo'ang slob tu bcug ste /
translated: There he studied letters, there he studied counting, there he studied enumeration, there he studied commerce, there he studied farming, there he studied the arts, and there he studied all the arts, even the arts of a menial.

original: de bzo thams cad la bslab cing /
analyzed: de bzo thams cad la bslab cing /

original: sgyu rtsal gyi rnam pa thams cad shes te /
analyzed: sgyu rtsal gyi rnam pa thams cad shes te /

original: sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi bslabs so //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi bslabs so //
translated: He studied the sixty-four arts.

original: sten grogs de dag dang lhan cig tu bkug shud kyis rtse ste /🔽de sgyu rtsal @401a *//
analyzed: sten grogs de dag dang lhan cig tu bkug shud kyis rtse ste / de sgyu rtsal @401a *//
translated: He played with those companions.🔽He studied all the arts.

original: thams cad la bslab pas sten grogs de dag la bslab pa thams cad ston to //
analyzed: thams cad la bslab pas sten grogs de dag la bslab pa thams cad ston to //
translated: He taught all the arts to those companions.

original: de nas sten grogs gcig gis yang dag pa'i tshig gis sku la bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas sten grogs gcig gis yang dag pa'i tshig gis sku la bar byed de /
translated: Then one of those companions, with correct words, admonished him:

analyzed: gzhon nu / khyod gzhan du 'gro ba'i skyon mi shes sam /

analyzed: skye bo gzhan gyis phyir rgol bar mi shes sam /

analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i gnyen ma yin pa'i skyon mi shes sam / 'brog gi skyon mi shes sam /
translated: Don’t you know the danger of going to another country where you have no friends?🔽Don’t you know the danger of the wilderness?

original: chu'i dgon pa'i skyon mi shes sam /🔽bza' ba dgon pa dang / btung ba dgon pa dang / sko ma dgon pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
analyzed: chu'i dgon pa'i skyon mi shes sam / bza' ba dgon pa dang / btung ba dgon pa dang / sko ma dgon pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
translated: Don’t you know the danger of the desert?🔽Don’t you know the danger of the desert of food, the desert of drink, and the desert of firewood?

original: mi mdza' ba'i dgon pa dang / rkun pos dkrugs pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
analyzed: mi mdza' ba'i dgon pa dang / rkun pos dkrugs pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
translated: Don’t you know the danger of the desert of enemies and the danger of the desert of thieves?

original: gcan gzan khro bas dkrugs pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
analyzed: gcan gzan khro bas dkrugs pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
translated: Don’t you know the danger of the desert of wild animals?

original: chus dkrugs pa dang / rgya mtshor song ba'i gru bo che 'jig pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
analyzed: chus dkrugs pa dang / rgya mtshor song ba'i gru bo che 'jig pa'i skyon mi shes sam /
translated: Don’t you know the danger of the desert of water and the danger of the desert of the great ocean?

original: srin mos 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa thams cad las yongs su grol ba mi shes sam /
analyzed: srin mos 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa thams cad las yongs su grol ba mi shes sam /
translated: Don’t you know the danger of the desert of rākṣasīs and the danger of all the harms?

original: gzhon nu / khyod gzhan gyi rdzas kyis yongs su spyod dam /
analyzed: gzhon nu / khyod gzhan gyi rdzas kyis yongs su spyod dam /
translated: Young man, do you enjoy using the possessions of others?

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa de nyid mi shes te /
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa de nyid mi shes te /
translated: You do not know the nature of your own suffering.

original: chos ma yin pas bslus so //
analyzed: chos ma yin pas bslus so //
translated: You are deceived by non-Dharma.🔽“

original: sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa'i rdzas ya nga ba'i rdzas 'di dag mi dgongs sam zhes te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa'i rdzas ya nga ba'i rdzas 'di dag mi dgongs sam zhes te /
translated: “Do you not consider these terrible substances that are included in suffering?”

original: sten grogs des yongs su bskul bar gyur @401b to; ;tshig shin tu thos nas sems pa'i rjes su zhugs te nyes pa de dag thams cad snying la bzhag nas des de la smras pa /
analyzed: sten grogs des yongs su bskul bar gyur @401b to; ;tshig shin tu thos nas sems pa'i rjes su zhugs te nyes pa de dag thams cad snying la bzhag nas des de la smras pa /
translated: “Having heard these words, he took them to heart and thought about all those faults. He said to his friend:

original: sten grogs / bdag la bsgo ba legs so; ;legs so //
analyzed: sten grogs / bdag la bsgo ba legs so; ;legs so //
translated: ‘Friend, you have given me good advice.

original: da ltar gyi nor bsags pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar gyi nor bsags pa ni /
translated: The wealth that is accumulated in this life

original: sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: is suffering.

original: sten grogs / de lta bas na /
analyzed: sten grogs / de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore, friend,

original: bdag nyid kyi nor rdzas yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nor rdzas yang dag par bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: I will gather my own wealth.’

original: des pha ma dag la smras pa /
analyzed: des pha ma dag la smras pa /
translated: “He said to his parents,

original: yab yum / tshong la mchi zhing ded dpon gyi bzo nus par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yab yum / tshong la mchi zhing ded dpon gyi bzo nus par bgyi'o //
translated: ‘Father, Mother, I will go to trade and learn the work of a caravan leader.’

original: de nas pha ma dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas pha ma dag gis smras pa /
translated: His parents said,

original: gzhon nu / khyod gzhan du 'gro bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: gzhon nu / khyod gzhan du 'gro bar ma byed cig /
translated: ‘Young man, do not go anywhere else.

original: bu gzhan du 'gro ba la skyon dpag tu med pa yod do //
analyzed: bu gzhan du 'gro ba la skyon dpag tu med pa yod do //
translated: Son, there are countless faults in going elsewhere.’

original: bdun brgyud tshun chad kyi phugs kyi nor rdzas rab tu mang po de dag yod de /
analyzed: bdun brgyud tshun chad kyi phugs kyi nor rdzas rab tu mang po de dag yod de /
translated: “There is a great deal of wealth in the seven generations of your ancestors.

original: 'khrul pa med par 'dug gi /🔽gang de dag la yongs su spyod la /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med par 'dug gi / gang de dag la yongs su spyod la /
translated: It is not a mistake.🔽You should enjoy it.

original: khyod gang gzhan du 'gro bar byas pa med par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod gang gzhan du 'gro bar byas pa med par gyis shig /
translated: Do not go anywhere else.”

original: bu gzhan du 'gro ba dang / nor rdzas yang dag par bsdu ba de la'ang sdug bsngal mang ste /
analyzed: bu gzhan du 'gro ba dang / nor rdzas yang dag par bsdu ba de la'ang sdug bsngal mang ste /
translated: “Son, there is much suffering in going elsewhere and in gathering wealth.

original: gzhon nu 'di nas ma 'byung bar nor rdzas kyis nor rdzas kyi bya ba gyis shig /
analyzed: gzhon nu 'di nas ma 'byung bar nor rdzas kyis nor rdzas kyi bya ba gyis shig /
translated: Young man, do not leave here. Do your business with wealth with wealth.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: yab / de ltar ma lags te /
analyzed: yab / de ltar ma lags te /
translated: “Father, it is not like that.🔽You have not spoken correctly.

original: yang dag par ma gsungs so; ;de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par ma gsungs so; ;de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te bdag gi bdun brgyud kyi zung gis nor rdzas btsal ba de ci bus yongs su ma spyad dam /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi bdun brgyud kyi zung gis nor rdzas btsal ba de ci bus yongs su ma spyad dam /
translated: If the wealth that my seven generations of ancestors sought is not enjoyed by me,

original: gang drug pa'i zung gis btsal ba de ci @402a *//
analyzed: gang drug pa'i zung gis btsal ba de ci @402a *//
translated: why is the wealth that my six generations of ancestors sought

original: bus yongs su ma spyad dam /
analyzed: bus yongs su ma spyad dam /
translated: not enjoyed by me?🔽Why is the wealth that my five generations of ancestors sought

analyzed: gang lnga pa'i zung gis bsgrubs pa de ci bus yongs su ma spyad dam /

analyzed: gang mes kyi yab kyi bar gyis bsgrubs pa de ci mes kyis yongs su ma spyad dam /
translated: “ ‘Did your grandfather not use the wealth that your great-grandfather had accumulated?

analyzed: gang yab kyi yab kyis bsgrubs pa'i nor rdzas de ci yab kyis yongs su ma spyad dam /
translated: Did your father not use the wealth that his father had accumulated?

analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang gnyen gyis bsgrubs pa'i nor rdzas yongs su spyod par mi spro'o //
translated: In the same way, I do not want to use the wealth that my relatives have accumulated.’

original: de pha ma'i 'dod pa dag med nas gru bo che'i tshong pa dang song ste /
analyzed: de pha ma'i 'dod pa dag med nas gru bo che'i tshong pa dang song ste /
translated: “ ‘Then, since his parents would not consent, he went to sea with a merchant.

analyzed: de rgya mtsho chen por zhugs pa dang / rlung gis gru bo che rin po che'i gling du phul to //
translated: When he had gone out to sea, the ship was blown by the wind to the island of jewels.

analyzed: des nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa sna tshogs dag gis gra bo che bkang ngo //
translated: He filled the ship with priceless jewels.

analyzed: de 'gro ba shin tu grub nas phyir log ste rgya mtsho las de rgal nas rgya mtsho la nye reg byas pa dang / nor bu rin po che lag pa la btags pa rgya mtsho chen por lhung ngo //
translated: When he had completed his voyage and returned, he crossed the ocean and, as he was touching the water of the ocean, the jewel that he had on his hand fell into the great ocean.

original: des nor bu rin po che de lhung ba tsam nyid kyis chu phyags thogs te /
analyzed: des nor bu rin po che de lhung ba tsam nyid kyis chu phyags thogs te /
translated: The moment he saw that the jewel had fallen, he took a scoop and

original: nor bu rin po che'i phyir de ring rgya mtsho 'di skam par bya'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i phyir de ring rgya mtsho 'di skam par bya'o //
translated: thought, “Today I will dry up this ocean for the sake of the jewel.”

original: snyam nas des chu phyags thogs te rgya mtsho chen po skam par brtsams pa dang / des chu phyags bzung ma thag tu lha bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag brgya dag grogs byed par grub par gyur te /
analyzed: snyam nas des chu phyags thogs te rgya mtsho chen po skam par brtsams pa dang / des chu phyags bzung ma thag tu lha bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag brgya dag grogs byed par grub par gyur te /
translated: As soon as he took the scoop, a hundred thousand quintillion gods became his companions to dry up the great ocean.

original: rlung yang grogs @402b byed par gyur /
analyzed: rlung yang grogs @402b byed par gyur /
translated: The wind also became his companion.

original: mi'ang grogs byed bar gyur to //
analyzed: mi'ang grogs byed bar gyur to //
translated: People also became his companions.

original: de nas chu phyags kyis chu phyags ma thag tu rlung gis ni /
analyzed: de nas chu phyags kyis chu phyags ma thag tu rlung gis ni /
translated: Then, as soon as the scoop was used to scoop up the water, the wind

original: ske ma / mes ni /
analyzed: ske ma / mes ni /
translated: dried it up.🔽Fire also🔽dried it up.

original: sreg go / de nas rgya mtsho'i lha de dag gis tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: sreg go / de nas rgya mtsho'i lha de dag gis tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: Then the ocean gods spoke in verse:

original: rgya mtsho 'di ni mtha' yas mi zad de //
analyzed: rgya mtsho 'di ni mtha' yas mi zad de //
translated: “This ocean is limitless and inexhaustible.

original: chu zad 'gyur gyi rgya mtsho de lta min //
analyzed: chu zad 'gyur gyi rgya mtsho de lta min //
translated: The water may dry up, but not the ocean.

original: grogs po mkha' la lam gyi tshad 'dod ltar /
analyzed: grogs po mkha' la lam gyi tshad 'dod ltar /
translated: Friend, it is like wanting to measure the path in the sky.

original: rgya mtsho bskams pa dag tu ji ltar nus //
analyzed: rgya mtsho bskams pa dag tu ji ltar nus //
translated: How could I dry up the ocean?

original: des lha de dag la tshigs su bcad de slar smras pa /
analyzed: des lha de dag la tshigs su bcad de slar smras pa /
translated: “Then the bodhisattva will reply to the gods in verse:

original: lha dag rgya mtsho mtha' yas ma yin te //
analyzed: lha dag rgya mtsho mtha' yas ma yin te //
translated: “ ‘Gods, the ocean is not limitless;

original: rgya mtsho dpag tshad mtha' yas dpag tu rnyed //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dpag tshad mtha' yas dpag tu rnyed //
translated: The ocean is limited to the extent that it can be measured.

original: bdag gis brtson 'grus mtha' yas dpag med de //
analyzed: bdag gis brtson 'grus mtha' yas dpag med de //
translated: My diligence is limitless and immeasurable;

original: rgya mtsho chen po bdag gis skam par nus //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po bdag gis skam par nus //
translated: I can dry up the great ocean.

original: rgya mtsho'i lha dag bdag gi stobs la ltos; ;mkha' la lha yis rab tu gang ba ltos //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i lha dag bdag gi stobs la ltos; ;mkha' la lha yis rab tu gang ba ltos //
translated: “ ‘Gods of the ocean, behold my power! Behold the sky filled with gods!

original: dpag med lha dag bdag gi grogs yin te //
analyzed: dpag med lha dag bdag gi grogs yin te //
translated: The gods are my immeasurable friends.

original: 'bar dang sreg dang de bzhin rlung du byed //
analyzed: 'bar dang sreg dang de bzhin rlung du byed //
translated: They will burn, scorch, and do the same with the wind.

original: bdag gis mkha' la chu gtor ba dag ltos //
analyzed: bdag gis mkha' la chu gtor ba dag ltos //
translated: “ ‘Behold the water I pour into the sky!

original: nam mkha' der ni 'go ba med pa ltos //
analyzed: nam mkha' der ni 'go ba med pa ltos //
translated: Behold the sky that is without a source!

original: sna tshogs dag ni bdag gi grogs 'gyur te //
analyzed: sna tshogs dag ni bdag gi grogs 'gyur te //
translated: The various gods will be my friends

original: bar snang chu ni sreg cing skem par byed //
analyzed: bar snang chu ni sreg cing skem par byed //
translated: And burn and dry up the water in the sky.

original: bar snang rlung ni bdag gi grogs yin te //
analyzed: bar snang rlung ni bdag gi grogs yin te //
translated: “ ‘The wind in the sky is my friend.

original: rgya mtsho skam pa dag la zhum pa med //
analyzed: rgya mtsho skam pa dag la zhum pa med //
translated: I will not be discouraged in drying up the ocean.

original: rgya mtshos bdag gi nor bu ma btang na //
analyzed: rgya mtshos bdag gi nor bu ma btang na //
translated: If the ocean does not return my jewel,

original: bdag la yon gnas stobs dang @403a *//🔽ldan pa ste //
analyzed: bdag la yon gnas stobs dang @403a *// ldan pa ste //
translated: I will have a powerful object of offering.🔽My object of offering will be the Buddha Jewel,

original: bdag gi yon gnas sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang // de bzhin spros med nges par 'byung ba'i chos //
analyzed: bdag gi yon gnas sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang // de bzhin spros med nges par 'byung ba'i chos //
translated: And likewise the Dharma Jewel, which is free from elaborations and is the means of escape,

original: 'dren pa'i sras de dge 'dun rin chen yod //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i sras de dge 'dun rin chen yod //
translated: And the Saṅgha Jewel, which is the sons of the Guide.

original: de dag bdag gir 'gyur te mtsho lha'i min //
analyzed: de dag bdag gir 'gyur te mtsho lha'i min //
translated: They will be mine, not the ocean god’s.

original: skyes bu khyod kyi tshig ni nges pa ste //
analyzed: skyes bu khyod kyi tshig ni nges pa ste //
translated: “Your words are certain, O man.

original: de bzhin brtson stobs khyod dang ldan pa legs //
analyzed: de bzhin brtson stobs khyod dang ldan pa legs //
translated: It is good that you have such diligence and strength.

original: nor bu dang ni ldan par 'gyur te sbyin //
analyzed: nor bu dang ni ldan par 'gyur te sbyin //
translated: You will be endowed with a jewel, so give it away.

original: de ring dkon mchog gsum la 'bul bar gyis //
analyzed: de ring dkon mchog gsum la 'bul bar gyis //
translated: Today you should offer it to the Three Jewels.”

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon slong ldan zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na ded dpon slong ldan zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the merchant named Arthadarśin at that time, on that occasion, was someone else,

original: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: you should think otherwise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na de dpon gyi bu slong ldan zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na de dpon gyi bu slong ldan zhes bya bar gyur to //

translated: He served countless thus-gone ones,🔽and he possessed countless accumulated roots of virtue.

analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /

translated: those who had attained mastery, and so forth, up to

translated: At that time, in the country of King Bhadraśreṣṭhin called Jayā, 9,900,000,000 beings shaved their heads and beards, put on the kāṣāya robe,

analyzed: khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //
translated: and went forth from home to homelessness in the presence of that Tathāgata.

original: de dag thams cad bde ba skyed par ni; gyur na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bde ba skyed par ni; gyur na /

original: de dag le lo med pa'ang rnyed par gyur to //

analyzed: de'i tshe brtson 'grus shes kun 'byung ba shes pa yang dag par rab tu ldan pa'i gtam 'di lta bu 'di dag mdzad do //

analyzed: gang zag theg pa bde bas brtson 'grus shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa sgrub par 'dod pas lam bar mas rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Those who wish to accomplish the knowledge of striving and the knowledge of the arising of striving through the easy vehicle of the individual should realize it through the middle path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dus dang dus ma yin par sgom pa la zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus kyis brtson 'grus @404b yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom par bya'o //

translated: Through the striving of not being discouraged in cultivating the factors of enlightenment at the right time and the wrong time, one should cultivate the factor of enlightenment of right effort.

analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom par bya'o //

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag btang snyoms su bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag btang snyoms su bya ste /

original: de'ang dran pas brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang dran pas brtag par bya'o //
translated: And that should be examined with mindfulness.

original: sems can rnams la bde bar sems pa de'ang zas zhim po bza' ba dang ldan pa dang / gnas mal bde bar 'dug pa dang / lus gya nom pa sla bar 'gyur ro //

translated: The thought of happiness for sentient beings is also endowed with delicious food to eat, staying in a comfortable bed, and the body becomes refined and easy.

original: brtson 'grus kyi spyad pa rtsom pas sdug bsngal dang phral zhing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi spyad pa rtsom pas sdug bsngal dang phral zhing /

original: shes pa bar ma des bde bar nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa bar ma des bde bar nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: By that middling knowledge, one definitely attains happiness.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po grags bzang de chos bshad pa de dag la gus par byas shing thos la brtson 'grus shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po grags bzang de chos bshad pa de dag la gus par byas shing thos la brtson 'grus shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: At that time, King Bhadraśreṣṭha, having respected those Dharma teachings and being diligent in listening, realized the knowledge of the arising of knowledge and attained acceptance of the non-arising of phenomena.

translated: When this was said, the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana said to the Blessed One,

analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad kyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //

analyzed: zhes bshad pa 'di'i don ji ltar blta bar bgyi /

translated: The Blessed One said,

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /

analyzed: gang zag gi dbang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag chos ston pa go bar mdzad do //
translated: the Blessed Buddhas teach the Dharma by means of the faculties of individuals.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa sgrub par 'dod pas brtson 'grus mnyam pa nyid la mngon par brtson par bya zhing rtogs par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa sgrub par 'dod pas brtson 'grus mnyam pa nyid la mngon par brtson par bya zhing rtogs par bya /
translated: the bodhisattva who wishes to accomplish the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of striving should strive for and realize the sameness of striving.

analyzed: brtson 'grus shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa la chos so sor bged pa dang / zang zing so sor bged par yang bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of striving should be distributed in terms of the Dharma and distributed in terms of material things.

original: moonggal gyi bu /🔽ngas brtson 'grus shes pa 'gog pa shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag sems can rnams la phan pa bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji ltar thob par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu / ngas brtson 'grus shes pa 'gog pa shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag sems can rnams la phan pa bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus shes pa 'gog pa shes pa ji ltar thob par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
analyzed: ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
translated: in the past, when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct in order to attain the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of striving for the sake of benefiting sentient beings, I accumulated various immeasurable roots of virtue, thinking, “How can I attain the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of striving?”

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: in the past, thus have I heard…

original: de'i pha rol @405b gyi'ang ches pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdud dad pa zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar 'jig rten du byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i pha rol @405b gyi'ang ches pha rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdud dad pa zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar 'jig rten du byung ngo //
translated: Beyond that, even further beyond that, the Tathāgata called Māraśraddhā appeared in the world, a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, a Sugata, a Knower of the World, an Unsurpassed One, a Tamer of Men, a Teacher of Gods and Men, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdud dad pa de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bdud shugs 'chang zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdud dad pa de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bdud shugs 'chang zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: In the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata Māraśraddhā there appeared a Māra called Mārabala.

original: des sangs rgyas lnga brgya dag gi gsung rab la bdud kyi las byas so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la srid pa'i 'gro bar 'chi ba dang / skye ba de dang de dag tu mdud par 'dzin pa rjes su dran te /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas lnga brgya dag gi gsung rab la bdud kyi las byas so // de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la srid pa'i 'gro bar 'chi ba dang / skye ba de dang de dag tu mdud par 'dzin pa rjes su dran te /
translated: He created Māra’s works in the dispensation of five hundred Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag la bdud kyi las rnams byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag la bdud kyi las rnams byas so //
translated: He remembered the Tathāgatas in the various existences of his wanderings through the worlds, and the Māra’s works which he did to them when they were living and when they had passed entirely away.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos de dag dang / de bzhin gshegs ba so so'i gsung rab la bar chad byas pas bskal pa grangs med par log par ltung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos de dag dang / de bzhin gshegs ba so so'i gsung rab la bar chad byas pas bskal pa grangs med par log par ltung ngo //
translated: They will fall into the lower realms for countless eons because of their obstruction of the teachings of those thus-gone ones and their hearers.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa bdud dad pa de byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bzhed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de'i gsung rab la'ang bar chad bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa bdud dad pa de byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bzhed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de'i gsung rab la'ang bar chad bya bar 'dod do //
translated: They will also obstruct the teachings of the thus-gone ones who are about to awaken to buddhahood.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bdud dad pa de byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa dang / bdud shugs 'chang de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' bdud dad pa de byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa dang / bdud shugs 'chang de sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Māraśraddhā, who was seated at the seat of awakening, remembered his past lives with the māra Balabhadra.

original: de bdud shugs 'chang de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gzigs nas ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du @406a *//🔽mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad de /
analyzed: de bdud shugs 'chang de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gzigs nas ji lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du @406a *//🔽mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad de /
translated: He saw the roots of virtue of that māra Balabhadra and manifested the following miracle.

original: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad pas bdud shugs 'chang sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la mdud par bzung ba rjes su dran te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du mdzad pa mngon par 'du mdzad pas bdud shugs 'chang sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la mdud par bzung ba rjes su dran te /
translated: He manifested such a miracle that Māra’s power was overcome, and he remembered those past thus-gone ones.

original: gang sems can dmyal ba chen por skyes pa de dag rjes su dran /
analyzed: gang sems can dmyal ba chen por skyes pa de dag rjes su dran /
translated: He remembered those who had been born in the great hells,

original: gang sems can dmyal ba chen po'i rgyur gyur pa de dag rjes su dran nas de 'jigs skrag ste spu zing zhes byed nas skyo ba thob bo //
analyzed: gang sems can dmyal ba chen po'i rgyur gyur pa de dag rjes su dran nas de 'jigs skrag ste spu zing zhes byed nas skyo ba thob bo //
translated: and he remembered the causes for the great hells. He was terrified, his hair stood on end, and he became distressed.

original: skyo ba thob pas byang chub sems dpa' de la sems rab tu dang ba'i dad pa thob nas byang chub sems dpa' bdud dad pa de la tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: skyo ba thob pas byang chub sems dpa' de la sems rab tu dang ba'i dad pa thob nas byang chub sems dpa' bdud dad pa de la tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: Having become distressed, he gained faith in the bodhisattva and became devoted to him. He then spoke these verses to the bodhisattva:

original: shes rab chen po ye shes dpag med mnga' ba phan mdzad thugs rje can; ;'jig rten kun la phan pa mdzad pa bde gshegs khyod la skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: shes rab chen po ye shes dpag med mnga' ba phan mdzad thugs rje can; ;'jig rten kun la phan pa mdzad pa bde gshegs khyod la skyabs su mchi //
translated: “I go for refuge to you, Sugata, who has great wisdom, immeasurable wisdom, compassion, and benefit, and who acts for the benefit of the entire world.

original: ji ltar ral gri gzeb la mi mchis skad cig gyen du 'phar ltar bdag /
analyzed: ji ltar ral gri gzeb la mi mchis skad cig gyen du 'phar ltar bdag /
translated: Just as a sword does not remain in its scabbard, but leaps up, so do I.

original: de ltar rgyal ba khyod la dad ma bgyis pas sems dmyal sdug bsngal myong //

translated: I was the king named Jñānapūrvaṃgama, who knew the past, who knew the origin, and who investigated, at that time, on that occasion.”🔽“Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: moonggal gyi bu; de lta bas na /

original: moonggal gyi bu /

analyzed: shi nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes par gyur to //

analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: ngas skye bo de dag las bdag gir bya ba shes pa la btsud cing rab tu bkod de /

analyzed: shes pa'i gnyen po skyes nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes so //
translated: When the antidote of knowledge arose, they were reborn in the world of Brahmā.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas las bdag gir bya bar shes pa la rab tu gnas par bya'o //

analyzed: ngas sngon gyi mtha' shas pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas pa nas yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i bar du'o

analyzed: // moonggal gyi bu /

analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med cing grangs med pa de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches @416b pha rol na drang srong lam phyin zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje dang ldan pa'i sems kyis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya ste /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
